name: Holiday Inn Sheffield

reviews.text: We stayed at the Holiday inn last week - we only discovered today 19/6 it is a franchised holiday inn - ie only the name. We stayed for two nights. The first night excellent - apart from to go to the gym you have to walk through the hotel bar which is also used as a function room - we weren't too happy about walking through a wedding reception in our gym kit - the bride looked even less happy.
reviews.title: Absolutely dreadful

reviews.text: The breakfast was ok - normal hotel full english - nothing special. At 9pm we had to swap rooms, our room was at the rear of the hotel and there was a function on - all we could hear with the windows shut was the thud of loud music and people outside shouting.
reviews.title: Not your normal Holiday Inn

likes.disliked: — Not wonderful views from any part of hotel

reviews.text: The next morning we went out shopping - we had packed but we left a PSP on charge - on our return it had been stolen. The hotel can tell us exactly who went in to the room at 11.05 - one of their cleaners, who is claiming the tv was on and she then left the room, without going in. We have asked the question why did she enter our room - we had not checked out. We are sure it was this lady who has stolen the games console - the room wasn't entered again. We have informed the police and have written to the hotel owner.
reviews.title: Holiday Inn stuck in the 1980's

reviews.text: The attitude of the management is appalling - we don't believe you - we don't want to be involved. The manager couldn't even give me the girls full name
reviews.title: Really friendly staff

likes.liked: — The staff who really made the stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want a good trip I would recommend the Hilton across the road.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but noisy!
Nice hotel, but a little noisy

likes.liked: — Location, free parking and Jacuzzi in bathroom

reviews.text: I had a Spa room with a nice hot tub. Hotel is a little old fashioned, and could do with a renovation.
reviews.title: Liked the old fashioned ambience

likes.liked: — Old fashioned ambience of the hotel
likes.disliked: — The bedroom was in need of refurbishment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No problems with free the free parking, and staff were very nice and professional.
reviews.title: Not your typical Holiday Inn

likes.disliked: — no air con on a hot night!

reviews.text: My only issue with the hotel was the noise. With the Christmas Party season, I was near function rooms with loud music until 1am.
reviews.title: Friendly, older style hotel

reviews.text: If I were to stay again, I would ensure I would be higher up in the building.
reviews.title: disturbed by noise restaurant a bit pricey
Great Hotel
reviews.text: I've stayed in many hotels around the world and I can honestly say our stay at the Holiday Inn (Royal Victoria) is within the top 20.
Return to a bygone age with hugh rooms, vaulted ceilings, breathtaking stairwells, classy decor and stunning rooms. We were in the executive rooms which were well appointed and had huge bathrooms.
reviews.title: Wonderful Historic Building

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights in Sheffield for a friend's 40th. As I was a student there in the early 90s it was great to go back and see how the city has changed. Many of the designer stores moved out when Meadowhall first opened, and it all started getting a bit run down, but all the modern new developments around West Street, the Winter Garden and the Peace Garden are really helping bring the city back to life.
reviews.title: EXcellent value

likes.liked: — Beautiful building, great service, choice of pillows.

reviews.text: The Holiday Inn is located about ten minutes walk from the Cathedral and within 5 minutes drive of the train station. The listed building is beautiful, retaining its period features. Although our room was in a newer wing, we had a very large double room with high ceilings. The bathroom was nice and modern, but as I am small I could not reach the bath/shower taps without getting into the bath as the glass shower screen got in the way!
reviews.title: Decent Hotel...10 mins to city centre
Difficult to find, but pleasant suprise when found
reviews.text: Tea and coffee making facilities (and biscuits) , hairdryer and a safe were provided in the room. There was also a choice of pillows, which I really liked. Room service was efficient and really quick, as was housekeeping (we borrowed an iron and board and they arrived within minutes).

reviews.title: fantastic restaurant
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was very good, offering a nice selection of cereals, fruit, cold meats and cheeses, patisserie and traditional cooked breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay there next time I visit Sheffield.
reviews.title: Good refurbishment of a traditional hotel

likes.liked: — staff were all very friendly, traditional feel of hotel, free car parking
likes.disliked: — the markets area that it borders

description: The Holiday Inn Sheffield Hotel is situated at the end of it s own private drive and so enjoys a quiet and peaceful location. All our bedrooms at the hotel have Hi Speed Internet Access. This 4 Star full service hotel offers fine dining in Cunningham s Restaurant or relaxed drinks and snacks in our Grand Lounge Bar. The Esperanto Health Suite is open 24 hours and features a fully equipped multi gym, dance studio, sauna s. These facilities are free for resident guests. One of the most striking features of this Grade 2 listed building is the elegant Victorian Ballroom which can accommodate up to 400 guests. All our meeting rooms at the Holiday Inn Sheffield Hotel have natural daylight and wireless internet access.The Holiday Inn Sheffield Hotel is within walking distance of Ponds Forge, The Crucible and Lyceum Theatres. Also within a short drive from the Holiday Inn Sheffield are Meadowhall Shopping Centre, Ice Sheffield and the English Institute of Sport Sheffield.The Holiday Inn Sheffield Hotel is just a half a mile from Sheffield Train Station and Sheffield Bus Station. Travelling by car, we are located a few miles from Junction 33 of the M1 Motorway. Sat Nav Users please use the street name Victoria Station Road, Sheffield and not the postcode to reach your final destination.
